text: Garðar (also spelled Gardar) is an Old Norse word meaning "strongholds", "enclosures" or "settlements". It may refer to: also means Garðar in Icelandic == Places and jurisdictions == In the meaning "strongholds": * Garðaríki, modern territory of Ukraine and Belarus. In the meaning "settlements": * Garðar, Greenland, a Norse settlement and titular see * Gardar, North Dakota, an unincorporated community in the US, built up chiefly by Icelanders == Persons == * Garðar Árnason (born 1938), Icelandic footballer * Garðar Thór Cortes (born 1974), Icelandic tenor * Gardar Eide Einarsson (born 1976), Norwegian-born artist * Garðar Gunnlaugsson (born 1983), Icelandic football forward * Garðar Jóhannsson (born 1980 ), Icelandic football striker * Garðar Svavarsson (fl. 860s), Swede who was the first Scandinavian to live on Iceland == See also == * Homo gardarensis, a paleontological false type of man named after the above Greenland town * Garðarsson Category:Icelandic masculine given names
title: Garðar
